revised_title: Rosenhain Centenary Conference: Engineering Requirements and Advances in Materials for Aircraft Airframes, Undercarriages, and Engines
tldr: The conference discussed engineering requirements and advancements in materials for aircraft airframes, undercarriages, and engines. Key topics included improving fatigue properties, resistance to stress corrosion, and the use of stronger materials like aluminum alloys, high-strength steels, and titanium alloys. The focus was on collaboration between engineers and metallurgists to address challenges and develop better materials for the aviation industry.
